title: League of Legends (Windows 10)
body:
SOLUTION DOWN BELOW!

Hey all,

Upgraded to windows 10 the other week, decided to get onto LoL to switch up games. I tried deleting rads stuff, and doing a fresh install of league currently. If this does not work what is my next step to take?

The issue is black screen after champ select when it loads you into the game. I do not see any of the picks, but get the noise of being sent to the fields of justice.

Solution brought to you by Kazuto Ishin (so you don't have to scroll):

> [{quoted}](name=Kazuto Ishin,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=MbIHEeV9,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-05-28T01:15:01.243+0000)
>
> okay so i actually had the same bug in the past and it seems like it's finally stopped happening, what you want to do is if you have intel, go to their website and download their updater tool, once you have it open it as admin and search for updates, select those updates and hit yes to anything that pops up from it. after you do that and install it, DO NOT RESTART YOUR COMPUTER after the install. 
> 
> next you go to your settings and click on updates and let it download any updates it has and click it a few times to make sure it has checked properly. once you do that head to a custom game and try out league, it should work perfectly.
> 
> i had been in contact with riot support about the exact same issue and it was never resolved. after messing around with my computer and updating stuff i finally found that fix. for whatever reason everytime my computer restarted all the updates were lost and i had to reinstall them in the same order. but finally it seems i can restart my computer and just head into a game without having to update.
> 
> 100% guarantee this.
> 
> Edit: do not ever restart you computer after doing the updates through both programs. if it is turned off or you chose to restart it to update something else you must repeat the process of updating Intel Then Windows

I did restart mine and it worked (must have just gotten lucky) but this DID fix it!

replies.body:
Given that you can't see anything, but can still hear the game being played, it sounds like you are able to connect to the individual game server, but your computer isn't able to render any of the information to appear on your screen.  The root cause of this may very well be Windows 10 and certain hardware not getting the proper software updates.  In an effort to resolve this, make sure to complete all of the steps in our [Game Crash Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974).  There are a lot of steps there, but they should hopefully get League to appear normally so you can get back onto the Rift.

Feel free to reply back and let me know if your problem still exists!

I have done most of the steps except for downloading net3.5 I get it to download fine, and get it to pop up and say "Are you sure you want to install this" you know the usual, but it never installs. 

Now does league run in compatibility mode? If so I may tinker with that as well.

EDIT: Alright, figured out what's going on. The sad part is I do not have a solution.

Steps I took to fix my game: Listed above in your Crash Guide plus some of my own tinkering:

Made it admin
Ran it in compatibility mode for windows 8
and checked disable high DPI and the choice under it.
Also clicked run: maximized.

Got into a game, started swapping settings around. Now it is running, but everything is zoomed in, so I set the right pixels, run it in full screen and BAM! Black screen once it loaded.

So I now know that it is full screen mode screwing me up, is there any way to undo that?

You can change your in-game settings by going into the actual game.cfg file in the installation.  It's found:

C:/Riot Games --> League of Legends --> Config

Once you open it in Notepad, you'll find a line item for +WindowMode=". Setting this to zero is Fullscreen borderless, 1 is windowed, and 2 is full-screen.  Alternatively, you can delete this entire file plus your PersistedSettings.json file in the same location when the client is open, which will set all of your in-game settings to default when you start a new game.

I hope this helps!  Let me know if you have any other questions!

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=MbIHEeV9,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-27T22:53:42.272+0000)
>
> You can change your in-game settings by going into the actual game.cfg file in the installation.  It's found:
> 
> C:/Riot Games --> League of Legends --> Config
> 
> Once you open it in Notepad, you'll find a line item for +WindowMode=". Setting this to zero is Fullscreen borderless, 1 is windowed, and 2 is full-screen.  Alternatively, you can delete this entire file plus your PersistedSettings.json file in the same location when the client is open, which will set all of your in-game settings to default when you start a new game.
> 
> I hope this helps!  Let me know if you have any other questions!

This is solved thanks to you! Boarderless is what fixed it and let me in game. Now it's going to be setting everything else up! Thank you so much!

EDIT: The map is off screen sadly in boarderless. Guna mess around see what I can find

EDIT 2: It is for sure full screen mode. Now new problem is, I am super zoomed in even the right resolution. In the worst resolution it is still fubar but not as bad.

Sitting in bot bush I can only see up to the entrance of river.

look at my comment, i am very sure that what i said is the real fix for this. i too tried following every step a support member gave me and it never worked out. for whatever reason after upgrading to windows 10 my Nvidia card stopped working and now my computer solely relies on my intel card. due to incompatibility with windows 10.

After doing some digging here is what I found in a MASSIVE file under R3D logs:

000009.300|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "Global/Champions/champions.bin" because it's not in the manifest.
000009.302|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "Global/Loadouts/SummonerBadges.bin" because it's not in the manifest.
000010.405|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.1.132/deploy/Data/Menu/IMEConfig.xml" because it's not in the manifest.
000010.405|  ERROR| Missing file on r3dGFile open :C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.1.132/deploy/Data/Menu/IMEConfig.xml
000010.405|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "\Bin\Data\C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.1.132/deploy/Data/Menu/IMEConfig.xml" because it's not in the manifest.
000010.405|  ERROR| Missing file on r3dGFile open :\Bin\Data\C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.1.132/deploy/Data/Menu/IMEConfig.xml
000012.506|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "UX/Fonts.bin" because it's not in the manifest.
000013.888|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "DATA/Globals/Globals.bin" because it's not in the manifest.

And the whole list just goes on. Those are probably not even half of the errors.

okay so i actually had the same bug in the past and it seems like it's finally stopped happening, what you want to do is if you have intel, go to their website and download their updater tool, once you have it open it as admin and search for updates, select those updates and hit yes to anything that pops up from it. after you do that and install it, DO NOT RESTART YOUR COMPUTER after the install. 

next you go to your settings and click on updates and let it download any updates it has and click it a few times to make sure it has checked properly. once you do that head to a custom game and try out league, it should work perfectly.

i had been in contact with riot support about the exact same issue and it was never resolved. after messing around with my computer and updating stuff i finally found that fix. for whatever reason everytime my computer restarted all the updates were lost and i had to reinstall them in the same order. but finally it seems i can restart my computer and just head into a game without having to update.

100% guarantee this.

Edit: do not ever restart you computer after doing the updates through both programs. if it is turned off or you chose to restart it to update something else you must repeat the process of updating Intel Then Windows
Going to try this right now. Currently I can play in borderless mode but have to use 1024 setting and when sitting in bot bush it is zoomed in to the point I can't see river

did my method work? after doing this you should be able to go back to fullscreen and whatever resolution you normally use. If i got your game working then my method does work, but i'm not sure about the resolution part. i didnt have an issue with that after.

Yes! After reversing all the trouble shooting I did, and did your method it worked flawlessly! Sorry I didn't get back to you about it, just tried it.

Now for me, I did the install, reboot (since it was on all night) and played, and didn't have a single issue!
awesome, glad i could help, took me a few months of trying to fully understand the problem, i wish riot would see this so they could tell others when they have the issue how to fix it.

I just recently got a new comp with WinX and have not had any issues so far. Not sure if this is entirely related to WinX or not. I will say my comp came with WinX already loaded and I downloaded League directly from the website. Possible it could be related to the actual updating from one version to the other and not the actual OS itself.

EDIT: I hope everything works out for you and the issue gets resolved soon!
Thanks man! I think that is the issue, is it updating from 8 to 10 and theres an issue there that Riot does not/can not find? Idk.

Hi all,

so I had this same issue and I went in to:

C:/Riot Games --> League of Legends --> Config

and then changed the height and width to the standard resolution of my monitor while it was in full screen/borderless or "windowmode=0" in the config file and that worked.

Regards,
Arv9402
